description.narrative: The Pacific Islands Finance Twinning Scheme (PIFTS)supports the development of sound Public Financial Management (PFM) by Pacific Island Countries (PICs), primarily targeted at the member countries of the Pacific Island Financial Management Association (PIFMA) in conjunction with the Pacific Financial Technical Assistance Centre (PFTAC), delivers targeted PFM assistance to PICs, develops the knowledge and skills of selected PIC government officials, and the local capacity of selected institutions, to improve their PFM practices, and facilitates ongoing institutional relationship between participating PICs, Finance, Australian Government agencies, academic institutions, other levels of government and relevant international partners on PFM reform in the Pacific. The total value of this initiative is $0.6 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
